org.fluidity.features

Interface Scheduler


  • public interface Scheduler
    Provides scheduled and periodic command invocation. This component keeps a hard reference to the supplied commands until their scheduled invocation is canceled - either automatically or manually by calling Scheduler.Task.Control.cancel().

    NOTE: This component keeps a hard reference to the tasks supplied in its invoke(long, Scheduler.Task) and invoke(long, long, Scheduler.Task) methods. If you need periodic updates without the consequent hard reference, use Updates instead of directly using this component.

    Scheduled tasks may throw exceptions and errors. A task that throws an error is immediately canceled. A task that throws an exception for Scheduler.Task.Control.exceptionLimit() consecutive invocations is suspended for Scheduler.Task.Control.penaltyTime() milliseconds. If the task throws an exception right after the penalty, it is again suspended for the penalty time.

    The default penalty time can be configured by implementing a PropertyProvider component that returns a valid number for the TASK_EXCEPTION_PENALTY key. The default penalty time is 1 minute.

    The default exception limit can be configured by implementing a PropertyProvider component that returns a valid number for the TASK_EXCEPTION_LIMIT key. The default exception limit is 3.

    Usage

     @Component
 public final class MyComponent {

   private static final long period = TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.convert(1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);

   private volatile long timestamp;

   MyComponent(final Scheduler scheduler) {
     scheduler.invoke(period, period, () -> timestamp = System.currentTimeMillis());
   }

   …
 }

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Scheduler.Task
      A scheduled task.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String TASK_EXCEPTION_LIMIT
      The configuration property that specifies how many consecutive errors are tolerated in task invocations by default.
      static String TASK_EXCEPTION_PENALTY
      The configuration property that specifies how long a task is suspended, in milliseconds, after too many consecutive errors.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Scheduler.Task.Control invoke(long delay, Scheduler.Task task)

    • Field Detail

      • TASK_EXCEPTION_LIMIT

        static final String TASK_EXCEPTION_LIMIT
        The configuration property that specifies how many consecutive errors are tolerated in task invocations by default. Can be overridden for individual tasks via Scheduler.Task.Control.exceptionLimit().
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TASK_EXCEPTION_PENALTY

        static final String TASK_EXCEPTION_PENALTY
        The configuration property that specifies how long a task is suspended, in milliseconds, after too many consecutive errors. Can be overridden for individual tasks via Scheduler.Task.Control.penaltyTime().
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        Scheduler.Task.Control invoke(long delay,
                              long period,
                              Scheduler.Task task)
        Adds the given task to be invoked at a fixed period milliseconds rate after delay milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay in milliseconds before the first invocation.
        period - the time in milliseconds between the invocations.
        task - the task to invoke.
        Returns:
        an object to control the invocations.

      • invoke

        Scheduler.Task.Control invoke(long delay,
                              Scheduler.Task task)
        Adds the given task to be invoked after delay milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay in milliseconds before the invocation.
        task - the task to invoke.
        Returns:
        an object to control the invocation.
